description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4dap6","text":"We designed primers with a tail sequence that forms a six-nucleotide hairpin at temperature \u003c55oC, but not ≥55oC. These primers contain six phosphorothioate bonds starting at the complementary region to inhibit exonuclease T7 activity. The primers successfully amplified the target and, following incubation with a mixture of T7 exonuclease, DNA polymerase, and Taq DNA ligase, pseudo-circular double-stranded DNA formed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":95,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":110,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.funder_name: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ALLERGY AND INFECTIOUS DISEASES

keywords: circular, rolling circle amplification, RCA, sequencing
